item.title: 100 errors - changing/ adding ranks (client)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Death Style:

there’s nothing wrong with using notepad on a crappy rsps project

Your own choice if you don’t want to use the tools available. An IDE helps you with documentation, organization, compiling, debugging, running, code completion etc. And some keeps a history of your files so you have an easy backup solution if you don’t want to bother with GIT.

I also find IDEA quite useful when it comes to organizing external libraries, you have the IDE keeps a list of all libraries you’ve added, and you can very simple include the same ones to new projects.

Read full topic

@trilogy-reborn wrote:

well i suppose you aready know this but i didnt write this messy client.java (obviously you know that)
im sure you also notice im not the best coder, and actually im semi new to it. and i avoid working on client sided problems as much as i possible can cause server sided coding seems to go okay but everytime i work on something client sided it gets messed up.
(yes i keep backups because i learned the hard way it is easy to mess up and need to restart.)

I do really want to code my unique server but i have a hard time learning to understand the codes (honestly some of the things you was saying above i had to look up what it meant lol). more or less i follow guides and snippets and i cant write simple things like commends, and stuff but i dont actually fully understand what im writing, i just memorized where to put what if that makes any since.

i want to get good developers to help me so i can start hosting soonish (but i have no plans in hosting leeched source without changing things to make it fun and unique) but i already have to pay for vps and forums so i dont have money to pay any developers

item.title: 100 errors - changing/ adding ranks (client)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Oh, sorry I mixed it up, it is not before the try. (Mixed up try,catch, with do, try )

The do statement should end before the while statement at the end.

do {… } while(…);

Your code is quite messy, it is hard to see without knowing too much about what your method is doing to understand what should be in which bracket. I would bet it would be at line 320 after the switch statement, since a switch statement is not supposed to contain anything apart from cases.

At line 322 you have code inside brackets, but nothing outside it to regulate how it is accessed (while, for, if etc.) This might be a source for another bug if you’ve removed something you shouldn’t remove.

Look at the unchanged client.java and use that to fix your problems, I assume you’re smart enough to keep a backup.

(All line numbers refer to the lines in method73)

A tip if you struggle with closing brackets properly is to write a simple comment at the end of each method, if/while/for statement to signify what you just ended.
For instance

if(x = 2){ ... } // End of if(x = 2)
And you can easily fix problems like this later.

Read full topic

} if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr1@")) { s = s.substring(5); boolean flag1 = true; byte byte0 = 1; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr2@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 2; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr3@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 3; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr4@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 4; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr5@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 5; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr6@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 6; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr7@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 7; } if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr8@")) { s = s.substring(5); byte byte0 = 8; } if(j1 == 0) l++; if((j1 == 1 || j1 == 2) && (j1 == 1 || publicChatMode == 0 || publicChatMode == 1 && isFriendOrSelf(s))) { if(j > k1 - 14 && j <= k1 && !s.equals(myPlayer.name)) { if(myPrivilege >= 1) { menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Report abuse @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 606; menuActionRow++; } menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Add ignore @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 42; menuActionRow++; menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Add friend @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 337; menuActionRow++; } l++; } if((j1 == 3 || j1 == 7) && splitPrivateChat == 0 && (j1 == 7 || privateChatMode == 0 || privateChatMode == 1 && isFriendOrSelf(s))) { if(j > k1 - 14 && j <= k1) { if(myPrivilege >= 1) { menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Report abuse @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 606; menuActionRow++; } menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Add ignore @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 42; menuActionRow++; menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Add friend @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 337; menuActionRow++; } l++; } if(j1 == 4 && (tradeMode == 0 || tradeMode == 1 && isFriendOrSelf(s))) { if(j > k1 - 14 && j <= k1) { menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Accept trade @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 484; menuActionRow++; } l++; } if((j1 == 5 || j1 == 6) && splitPrivateChat == 0 && privateChatMode < 2) l++; if(j1 == 8 && (tradeMode == 0 || tradeMode == 1 && isFriendOrSelf(s))) { if(j > k1 - 14 && j <= k1) { menuActionName[menuActionRow] = "Accept challenge @whi@" + s; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 6; menuActionRow++; } l++; } } }
25 open and 25 close

still looking at other spots that it mentions errors cause i havnt found it yet.
hope i dont get stuck spending days looking through all 14k lines of code lmao

EDIT: i did a full file search and found out i have:
"{" = 1710
"}" = 1709
so i am defiantly missing a closing bracket but im just having a hard time finding where it goes still

Read full topic

item.title: 100 errors - changing/ adding ranks (client)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Check before where the first error occurs. There’s most likely a bracket misplacement in buildDuelorTrade.

Read full topic

item.title: 100 errors - changing/ adding ranks (client)
item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn
item.description:
@trilogy-reborn wrote:

my source and client are hybridpvp v2

i was working in client.java (client sided)
trying to follow this guide to adding ranks because i base only had mod, admin, and owner.

My goal to add:
Normal player
mod
head mod
admin
head admin
co owner
owner
donator
super donator
veteran

I made the modicons and use toms cache suite to pack them to client.

I followed this guide: http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tutorials/348186-renamed-adding-custom-crowns-detailed-all-chat-types-rewritten-conventi.html#post2887670
